name: places/ChIJr_CugNxZwokRYRqcXtzJ8sQ
adrFormatAddress: 100 2nd Ave, New York, NY 10003-8307, USA

originalText.text: Hands down, the best Tiki bar in the city. The lighting, decorations, and atmosphere are funky and different seating options make this place perfect for large or small encounters. Brendan was a great bartender and provided helpful explanations + cocktail suggestions. I'd recommend the Bat Outta Hell (includes a beer coozie!) and the Cobra's Fang. Fantastic!

text.text: Hands down, the best Tiki bar in the city. The lighting, decorations, and atmosphere are funky and different seating options make this place perfect for large or small encounters. Brendan was a great bartender and provided helpful explanations + cocktail suggestions. I'd recommend the Bat Outta Hell (includes a beer coozie!) and the Cobra's Fang. Fantastic!

originalText.text: A cute new tiki-inspired bar with a twist in the E Village. Paradise Lost has so many wonderful details from the long hallway entrance to the bar above the bar, lights, and even a secret in the bathroom (hint: look for the button). All the drinks are tropical inspired and I loved the look of the rum flight that comes in a little treasure chest. There's a whole folklore story about the bar that they refer to as The Abyss. Food was also very delicious - we had dumplings, ribs, zucchini sticks & more. Staff was so friendly and fun. This opened just in time for Halloween but will def be fun year round. Enjoy!

originalText.text:
Big fan of tiki drinks and this place checks that box for proper drinks.

The atmosphere is on point. There’s a bit of a satanic vibe with a Lucifer painting and some goat demon. Not to mention the bathroom stalls have a nice touch. But they definitely invested in making the atmosphere trendy.

The drinks are great. Well crafted and themed accordingly. But on the pricier side, but I’ve seen worse.

Only negative was I didn’t know it was a 2-hour limit for a table and they could have been more vocal about that before I had to finish a drink within 15 minutes.

Overall, worth a visit if in the area.

originalText.text:
Love Love Love Paradise Lost! It's so nice to find an authentic tiki place in NY.

The drinks are delicious. And service is great! Everyone really cares about being authentic to the tiki vibe and also ensuring the guests are happy.

When we arrived they didn't have space but they found us a nice little corner to stand in. The minute a table opened, they moved us. The drinks were well crafted and I loved the attention to the small details.

The ambiance is a mix of goth, jungle, and 70's. It sounds odd but it totally works. A great spot for a date night or a small group hangout.

Paradise Lost really makes the effort to make the whole thing an experience.

We haven't had a chance to try the food but the next time we're back that's the definitely the plan.

Instagram: @TheShahLALand

originalText.text:
I’ve long thought a great tiki bar in NYC would make a killing so I’m extremely jealous about Paradise Lost which is absolutely a great new tiki bar.

You can tell the owners have thought about a lot of little details from interesting menu, detailed cocktails, cocktail based music and even the cool water bottles.

Main downside is seating was quite awkward and uncomfortable but the booths looked incredible. Will definitely come back
